about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when:

about.name: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when:

hasPart.assesses: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when: | If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

comment.text: The collision causes $1,000 in damage.

suggestedAnswer.text: You plan on being out of the state for more than 30 days.

comment.text: You plan on being out of the state for more than 30 days.

suggestedAnswer.text: You refinance the remaining balance of your vehicle loan.

comment.text: You refinance the remaining balance of your vehicle loan.
The collision causes $1,000 in damage.

answerExplanation.text: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

comment.text: If you are involved in a traffic accident in California, you must file a report of the accident with the DMV when: | If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

hasPart.name: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. The best speed for your vehicle is most likely:

hasPart.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver travels more quickly or more slowly than the other vehicles on the road. You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

comment.text: 25 mph.
35 mph.
30 mph.
35 mph.

answerExplanation.text: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver travels more quickly or more slowly than the other vehicles on the road. You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

comment.text: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is heavy and moving at 35 mph. hasPart.name: If you want to pass a pedestrian who is walking along the roadway and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:

about.name: If you want to pass a pedestrian who is walking along the roadway and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you want to pass a pedestrian who is walking along the roadway and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should: | If you want to pass a pedestrian who is walking along the roadway and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If possible, try to only deal with one roadway hazard at a time. If you want to pass a pedestrian but an oncoming vehicle is approaching, slow down and let the vehicle pass. You may then pass the pedestrian if it is safe to do so.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and let the oncoming vehicle pass before you pass the pedestrian.

comment.text: Slow down and let the oncoming vehicle pass before you pass the pedestrian.

suggestedAnswer.text: Keep driving at a steady speed. The oncoming vehicle must stop for you.

comment.text: Keep driving at a steady speed. The oncoming vehicle must stop for you.

suggestedAnswer.text: Honk your horn to get the pedestrian to move over.

comment.text: Honk your horn to get the pedestrian to move over.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and let the oncoming vehicle pass before you pass the pedestrian.

comment.text: Slow down and let the oncoming vehicle pass before you pass the pedestrian.

answerExplanation.text: If possible, try to only deal with one roadway hazard at a time. If you want to pass a pedestrian but an oncoming vehicle is approaching, slow down and let the vehicle pass. You may then pass the pedestrian if it is safe to do so.

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

comment.text: Trucks under 18,000 pounds are allowed.
Hill ahead.
Truck stop ahead.
Hill ahead.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

comment.text: This sign means: | Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign indicates that there is a steep hill ahead. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

hasPart.name: You should signal at least how many feet before you turn?

about.name: You should signal at least how many feet before you turn?

hasPart.assesses: You should signal at least how many feet before you turn? | You should signal at least how many feet before you turn? - Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You should signal at least 100 feet before you turn, before every lane change, at least five seconds before you change lanes on a freeway, before pulling next to the curb or away from the curb, even when you do not see other vehicles around you, and when you are almost through the intersection if you plan to turn shortly after crossing the intersection. Remember to turn off your signal when you no longer need it.

answerExplanation.text: You should signal at least 100 feet before you turn, before every lane change, at least five seconds before you change lanes on a freeway, before pulling next to the curb or away from the curb, even when you do not see other vehicles around you, and when you are almost through the intersection if you plan to turn shortly after crossing the intersection. Remember to turn off your signal when you no longer need it.

comment.text: You should signal at least how many feet before you turn? | You should signal at least 100 feet before you turn, before every lane change, at least five seconds before you change lanes on a freeway, before pulling next to the curb or away from the curb, even when you do not see other vehicles around you, and when you are almost through the intersection if you plan to turn shortly after crossing the intersection. Remember to turn off your signal when you no longer need it.
